history.content:
While those are good classes to take following CS 61C, I'm not sure how beneficial they are taken concurrently. CS 161 + CS 162 and CS 168 + CS 162 are most common, but I would recommend CS 168 + CS 162 since CS 162 is a high workload class, and CS 168 is on the lighter side (balances out) and is only offered in the Fall. However, if you don't have a project group for CS 162, and you're not willing to take the risk of pairing with randoms (I did and it turned out fine), then CS 161 + CS 168 are a great pair as well (decent amount of material overlap).

I'm a CS Peer Advisor, so feel free to stop by HP Auditorium M/W 2-4 PM if you want to chat more about this!

children.subject: Definitely outdated, check out @6464. Personally, I took CS 168 without CS 162, and I did not feel disadvantaged whatsoever. Concepts were still somewhat challenging, but OH helped out a ton!

To Steven (Student ans), thanks for the great advice! I'll be sure to stop by when I have time.

I was actually intending on taking 168 next semester however on the course catalog, it says that a prereq for 168 is 162 (http://guide.berkeley.edu/courses/compsci/). Is this still true or is it outdated? If so, would the recommendation be to do 161 and 162 together or take them one after the other?

I somewhat disagree - I took 162 last semester and am currently in 186. I felt much more supported by the detailed specs and design documents in 162, whereas in 186 I am floundering all by myself on these projects with vague af specs. Not to mention that 162 has no hidden tests... so imo they are the same difficulty. 

There's a lot of overlap though - caching, disk operations and I/O, concurrency, etc., but 186 talks about these things through a more narrow lens of database design.
Just want to add that 186 is relatively light compared to 162. Also, there is little overlap between them besides a short stint in concurrency and locks in 186.

history.content: Sophomore currently taking 61C and 170, HKN recommends to take 186 and 162 following 61c and I was wondering how difficult the classes are individually and together. Any advice is appreciated, and if you have other class suggestions in addition or in replacement of 186 or 162, that would be great :D
history.subject: CS186 with CS162?
